OriginalAxioms: https://w3id.org/saref terms:title SAREF: the Smart Appliances REFerence ontology

https://w3id.org/saref terms:description The Smart Appliances REFerence SAREF ontology is a shared model of consensus that facilitates the matching of existing assets standards/protocols/datamodels/etc. in the smart appliances domain. The SAREF ontology provides building blocks that allow separation and recombination of different parts of the ontology depending on specific needs. The starting point of SAREF is the concept of device e.g., a switch. Devices are tangible objects designed to accomplish a particular task in households, common public buildings or offices. In order to accomplish this task, the device performs one or more functions. For example, a washing machine is designed to wash task and to accomplish this task it performs the start and stop function. The SAREF ontology offers a lists of basic functions that can be eventually combined in order to have more complex functions in a single device. For example, a switch offers an actuating function of type switching on/off. Each function has some associated commands, which can also be picked up as building blocks from a list. For example, the switching on/off is associated with the commands switch on, switch off and toggle. Depending on the functions it accomplishes, a device can be found in some corresponding states that are also listed as building blocks. When connected to a network, a device offers a service, which  is a representation of a function to a network that makes the function discoverable, registerable and remotely controllable by other devices in the network. A service can represent one or more functions. A service is offered by a device that wants a certain set of its functions to be discoverable, registerable, remotely controllable by other devices in the network. A service must specify the device that is offering the service and the functions to be represented. A device in the SAREF ontology is also characterized by a profile that can be used to optimize some property, such as Energy, in a home or office that are part of a building.
:GetCurrentMeterValueCommand rdfs:label Get current meter value command
om:pound_sterling rdfs:label Great Britain pound sterling
InferredAxioms: time:hasBeginning skos:definition Beginning of a temporal entity.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:Instant rdfs:comment A temporal entity with zero extent or duration^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:generalYear skos:definition Year number - formulated as a text string with a pattern constraint to reproduce the same lexical form as gYear, but not restricted to values from the Gregorian calendar. 
Note that the value-space is not defined, so a generic OWL2 processor cannot compute ordering relationships of values of this type.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:dayOfYear rdfs:comment The number of the day within the year^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:dayOfWeek rdfs:comment The day of week, whose value is a member of the class time:DayOfWeek^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:minute rdfs:comment Minute position in a calendar-clock system.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:MonthOfYear rdfs:comment The month of the year^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:MonthOfYear skos:note Membership of the class :MonthOfYear is open, to allow for alternative annual calendars and different month names.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:intervalFinishedBy rdfs:comment If a proper interval T1 is intervalFinishedBy another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is before the beginning of T2, and the end of T1 is coincident with the end of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:inTemporalPosition skos:definition Position of a time instant^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:inXSDgYearMonth skos:definition Position of an instant, expressed using xsd:gYearMonth^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:DateTimeInterval skos:note :DateTimeInterval can only be used for an interval whose limits coincide with a date-time element aligned to the calendar and timezone indicated. For example, while both have a duration of one day, the 24-hour interval beginning at midnight at the beginning of 8 May in Central Europe can be expressed as a :DateTimeInterval, but the 24-hour interval starting at 1:30pm cannot.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:DurationDescription skos:definition Description of temporal extent structured with separate values for the various elements of a calendar-clock system. The temporal reference system is fixed to Gregorian Calendar, and the range of each of the numeric properties is restricted to xsd:decimal^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:numericPosition skos:definition The numeric value indicating position within a temporal coordinate system ^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:intervalMeets rdfs:comment If a proper interval T1 is intervalMeets another proper interval T2, then the end of T1 is coincident with the beginning of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:inXSDDateTime rdfs:comment Position of an instant, expressed using xsd:dateTime^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:unitWeek rdfs:label Week unit of temporal duration^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:hasTime rdfs:comment Supports the association of a temporal entity instant or interval to any thing^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:years rdfs:comment length of, or element of the length of, a temporal extent expressed in years^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:hasXSDDuration skos:editorialNote Feature at risk - added in 2017 revision, and not yet widely used. ^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:xsdDateTime skos:note Using xsd:dateTime in this place means that the duration of the interval is implicit: it corresponds to the length of the smallest non-zero element of the date-time literal. However, this rule cannot be used for intervals whose duration is more than one rank smaller than the starting time - e.g. the first minute or second of a day, the first hour of a month, or the first day of a year. In these cases the desired interval cannot be distinguished from the interval corresponding to the next rank up. Because of this essential ambiguity, use of this property is not recommended and it is deprecated.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:DateTimeInterval rdfs:comment DateTimeInterval is a subclass of ProperInterval, defined using the multi-element DateTimeDescription.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:inXSDDateTimeStamp skos:definition Position of an instant, expressed using xsd:dateTimeStamp^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:hasXSDDuration skos:definition Extent of a temporal entity, expressed using xsd:duration^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:inside skos:definition An instant that falls inside the interval. It is not intended to include beginnings and ends of intervals.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:intervalAfter skos:definition If a proper interval T1 is intervalAfter another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is after the end of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:hasDuration rdfs:comment Duration of a temporal entity, expressed as a scaled value or nominal value^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:Duration skos:definition Duration of a temporal extent expressed as a number scaled by a temporal unit^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:GeneralDurationDescription rdfs:comment Description of temporal extent structured with separate values for the various elements of a calendar-clock system.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:second rdfs:comment Second position in a calendar-clock system.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
http://www.w3.org/2006/time terms:rights Copyright © 2006-2017 W3C, OGC. W3C and OGC liability, trademark and document use rules apply.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:generalMonth rdfs:comment Month of year - formulated as a text string with a pattern constraint to reproduce the same lexical form as gMonth, except that values up to 20 are permitted, in order to support calendars with more than 12 months in the year. 
Note that the value-space is not defined, so a generic OWL2 processor cannot compute ordering relationships of values of this type.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:months skos:definition length of, or element of the length of, a temporal extent expressed in months^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:TRS rdfs:comment A temporal reference system, such as a temporal coordinate system with an origin, direction, and scale, a calendar-clock combination, or a possibly hierarchical ordinal system. 

This is a stub class, representing the set of all temporal reference systems.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:hasEnd rdfs:comment End of a temporal entity.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:inXSDDateTime skos:note The property :inXSDDateTime is replaced by :inXSDDateTimeStamp which makes the time-zone field mandatory.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:hasTime skos:editorialNote Feature at risk - added in 2017 revision, and not yet widely used. ^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:DayOfWeek skos:note Membership of the class :DayOfWeek is open, to allow for alternative week lengths and different day names.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:numericDuration rdfs:comment Value of a temporal extent expressed as a decimal number scaled by a temporal unit^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:TimeZone skos:definition A Time Zone specifies the amount by which the local time is offset from UTC. 
	A time zone is usually denoted geographically e.g. Australian Eastern Daylight Time, with a constant value in a given region. 
The region where it applies and the offset from UTC are specified by a locally recognised governing authority.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:year rdfs:comment Year position in a calendar-clock system.

The range of this property is not specified, so can be replaced by any specific representation of a calendar year from any calendar. ^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:minutes rdfs:comment length, or element of, a temporal extent expressed in minutes^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:TemporalUnit skos:changeNote Remove enumeration from definition, in order to allow other units to be used when required in other coordinate systems. 
NOTE: existing units are still present as members of the class, but the class membership is now open. 

In the original OWL-Time the following constraint appeared: 
  owl:oneOf 
      time:unitSecond
      time:unitMinute
      time:unitHour
      time:unitDay
      time:unitWeek
      time:unitMonth
      time:unitYear
     ;^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:before rdfs:comment Gives directionality to time. If a temporal entity T1 is before another temporal entity T2, then the end of T1 is before the beginning of T2. Thus, "before" can be considered to be basic to instants and derived for intervals.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:TemporalEntity skos:definition A temporal interval or instant.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:intervalIn skos:note This interval relation is not included in the 13 basic relationships defined in Allen 1984, but is referred to as an important relationship in Allen and Ferguson 1997. It is the disjoint union of :intervalStarts v :intervalDuring v :intervalFinishes . However, that is outside OWL2 expressivity, so is implemented as an explicit property, with :intervalStarts , :intervalDuring , :intervalFinishes as sub-properties^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:month rdfs:comment Month position in a calendar-clock system.

The range of this property is not specified, so can be replaced by any specific representation of a calendar month from any calendar. ^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:TRS skos:note A taxonomy of temporal reference systems is provided in ISO 19108:2002 [ISO19108], including a calendar + clock systems; b temporal coordinate systems i.e. numeric offset from an epoch; c temporal ordinal reference systems i.e. ordered sequence of named intervals, not necessarily of equal duration.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:intervalContains rdfs:comment If a proper interval T1 is intervalContains another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is before the beginning of T2, and the end of T1 is after the end of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:DateTimeDescription rdfs:comment Description of date and time structured with separate values for the various elements of a calendar-clock system. The temporal reference system is fixed to Gregorian Calendar, and the range of year, month, day properties restricted to corresponding XML Schema types xsd:gYear, xsd:gMonth and xsd:gDay, respectively.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:hours rdfs:comment length of, or element of the length of, a temporal extent expressed in hours^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

http://www.w3.org/2006/time skos:historyNote Update of OWL-Time ontology, extended to support general temporal reference systems. 

Ontology engineering by Simon J D Cox^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:days rdfs:comment length of, or element of the length of, a temporal extent expressed in days^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:monthOfYear rdfs:comment The month of the year, whose value is a member of the class time:MonthOfYear^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:ProperInterval rdfs:comment A temporal entity with non-zero extent or duration, i.e. for which the value of the beginning and end are different^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:intervalStartedBy rdfs:comment If a proper interval T1 is intervalStarted another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is coincident with the beginning of T2, and the end of T1 is after the end of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:inXSDgYear skos:definition Position of an instant, expressed using xsd:gYear^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:intervalIn skos:definition If a proper interval T1 is intervalIn another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is after the beginning of T2 or is coincident with the beginning of T2, and the end of T1 is before the end of T2, or is coincident with the end of T2, except that end of T1 may not be coincident with the end of T2 if the beginning of T1 is coincident with the beginning of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:hasDurationDescription skos:definition Duration of a temporal entity, expressed using a structured description^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:day rdfs:comment Day position in a calendar-clock system.

The range of this property is not specified, so can be replaced by any specific representation of a calendar day from any calendar. ^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:GeneralDateTimeDescription skos:definition Description of date and time structured with separate values for the various elements of a calendar-clock system^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:intervalOverlappedBy rdfs:comment If a proper interval T1 is intervalOverlappedBy another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is after the beginning of T2, the beginning of T1 is before the end of T2, and the end of T1 is after the end of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:hasTemporalDuration rdfs:comment Duration of a temporal entity.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:TimeZone skos:note An ontology for time zone descriptions was described in [owl-time-20060927] and provided as RDF in a separate namespace tzont:. However, that ontology was incomplete in scope, and the example datasets were selective. Furthermore, since the use of a class from an external ontology as the range of an ObjectProperty in OWL-Time creates a dependency, reference to the time zone class has been replaced with the stub class in the normative part of this version of OWL-Time.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:TemporalPosition skos:definition A position on a time-line^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:TemporalUnit skos:definition A standard duration, which provides a scale factor for a time extent, or the granularity or precision for a time position.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:hasTRS skos:definition The temporal reference system used by a temporal position or extent description. ^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:unitSecond rdfs:label Second unit of temporal duration^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:intervalEquals rdfs:comment If a proper interval T1 is intervalEquals another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is coincident with the beginning of T2, and the end of T1 is coincident with the end of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:intervalOverlaps skos:definition If a proper interval T1 is intervalOverlaps another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is before the beginning of T2, the end of T1 is after the beginning of T2, and the end of T1 is before the end of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:timeZone rdfs:comment The time zone for clock elements in the temporal position^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:DurationDescription skos:note In the Gregorian calendar the length of the month is not fixed. Therefore, a value like "2.5 months" cannot be exactly compared with a similar duration expressed in terms of weeks or days.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:intervalDuring skos:definition If a proper interval T1 is intervalDuring another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is after the beginning of T2, and the end of T1 is before the end of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:hasBeginning rdfs:comment Beginning of a temporal entity^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:TemporalDuration rdfs:comment Time extent; duration of a time interval separate from its particular start position^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:unitType rdfs:comment The temporal unit which provides the precision of a date-time value or scale of a temporal extent^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:intervalMetBy skos:definition If a proper interval T1 is intervalMetBy another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is coincident with the end of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:intervalBefore skos:definition If a proper interval T1 is intervalBefore another proper interval T2, then the end of T1 is before the beginning of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:hasDateTimeDescription skos:definition Value of DateTimeInterval expressed as a structured value. The beginning and end of the interval coincide with the limits of the shortest element in the description.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:timeZone skos:note IANA maintains a database of timezones. These are well maintained and generally considered authoritative, but individual items are not available at individual URIs, so cannot be used directly in data expressed using OWL-Time.

DBPedia provides a set of resources corresponding to the IANA timezones, with a URI for each e.g. http://dbpedia.org/resource/Australia/Eucla. The World Clock service also provides a list of time zones with the description of each available as an individual webpage with a convenient individual URI e.g. https://www.timeanddate.com/time/zones/acwst. These or other, similar, resources might be used as a value of the time:timeZone property.

time:intervalStarts rdfs:comment If a proper interval T1 is intervalStarts another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is coincident with the beginning of T2, and the end of T1 is before the end of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:hour skos:definition Hour position in a calendar-clock system.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:TimePosition skos:definition A temporal position described using either a nominal value from an ordinal reference system, or a numeric value in a temporal coordinate system. ^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:generalDay rdfs:comment Day of month - formulated as a text string with a pattern constraint to reproduce the same lexical form as gDay, except that values up to 99 are permitted, in order to support calendars with more than 31 days in a month. 
Note that the value-space is not defined, so a generic OWL2 processor cannot compute ordering relationships of values of this type.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
http://www.w3.org/2006/time skos:changeNote 2017-04-06 - hasTime, hasXSDDuration added; Number removed; all duration elements changed to xsd:decimal
time:unitDay rdfs:label Day unit of temporal duration^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:inXSDDate rdfs:comment Position of an instant, expressed using xsd:date^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:intervalFinishes skos:definition If a proper interval T1 is intervalFinishes another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is after the beginning of T2, and the end of T1 is coincident with the end of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
http://www.w3.org/2006/time skos:changeNote 2016-12-20 - adjust range of time:timeZone to time:TimeZone, moved up from the tzont ontology.

time:after skos:definition Gives directionality to time. If a temporal entity T1 is after another temporal entity T2, then the beginning of T1 is after the end of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:GeneralDurationDescription skos:note The extent of a time duration expressed as a GeneralDurationDescription depends on the Temporal Reference System. In some calendars the length of the week or month is not constant within the year. Therefore, a value like "2.5 months" may not necessarily be exactly compared with a similar duration expressed in terms of weeks or days. When non-earth-based calendars are considered even more care must be taken in comparing durations.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:seconds rdfs:comment length of, or element of the length of, a temporal extent expressed in seconds^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:inDateTime skos:definition Position of an instant, expressed using a structured description^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:Interval rdfs:comment A temporal entity with an extent or duration^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:intervalDisjoint skos:note This interval relation is not included in the 13 basic relationships defined in Allen 1984, but is defined in T.3 as the union of :intervalBefore v :intervalAfter . However, that is outside OWL2 expressivity, so is implemented as an explicit property, with :intervalBefore , :intervalAfter as sub-properties^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:intervalDisjoint rdfs:comment If a proper interval T1 is intervalDisjoint another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is after the end of T2, or the end of T1 is before the beginning of T2, i.e. the intervals do not overlap in any way, but their ordering relationship is not known.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:nominalPosition skos:definition The nominal value indicating temporal position in an ordinal reference system ^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:months rdfs:comment length of, or element of the length of, a temporal extent expressed in months^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:xsdDateTime rdfs:comment Value of DateTimeInterval expressed as a compact value.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:DayOfWeek skos:changeNote Remove enumeration from definition, in order to allow other days to be used when required in other calendars. 
NOTE: existing days are still present as members of the class, but the class membership is now open. 

In the original OWL-Time the following constraint appeared: 
  owl:oneOf 
      time:Monday
      time:Tuesday
      time:Wednesday
      time:Thursday
      time:Friday
      time:Saturday
      time:Sunday
     ;^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:hasEnd skos:definition End of a temporal entity.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:TRS skos:definition A temporal reference system, such as a temporal coordinate system with an origin, direction, and scale, a calendar-clock combination, or a possibly hierarchical ordinal system. 

This is a stub class, representing the set of all temporal reference systems.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:unitHour rdfs:label Hour unit of temporal duration^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:generalMonth skos:definition Month of year - formulated as a text string with a pattern constraint to reproduce the same lexical form as gMonth, except that values up to 20 are permitted, in order to support calendars with more than 12 months in the year. 
Note that the value-space is not defined, so a generic OWL2 processor cannot compute ordering relationships of values of this type.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:timeZone skos:historyNote In the original 2006 version of OWL-Time, the range of time:timeZone was a TimeZone class in a separate namespace "http://www.w3.org/2006/timezone#". 
An alignment axiom 
	tzont:TimeZone rdfs:subClassOf time:TimeZone . 
allows data encoded according to the previous version to be consistent with the updated ontology.
http://www.w3.org/2006/time skos:changeNote 2017-02 - intervalIn, intervalDisjoint, monthOfYear added; TemporalUnit subclass of TemporalDuration

time:before skos:definition Gives directionality to time. If a temporal entity T1 is before another temporal entity T2, then the end of T1 is before the beginning of T2. Thus, "before" can be considered to be basic to instants and derived for intervals.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:TemporalEntity rdfs:comment A temporal interval or instant.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:month skos:definition Month position in a calendar-clock system.

The range of this property is not specified, so can be replaced by any specific representation of a calendar month from any calendar. ^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
http://www.w3.org/2006/time skos:changeNote 2016-12-20 - restore time:Year and time:January which were present in the 2006 version of the ontology, but now marked "deprecated".
time:numericDuration skos:definition Value of a temporal extent expressed as a decimal number scaled by a temporal unit^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:TimeZone rdfs:comment A Time Zone specifies the amount by which the local time is offset from UTC. 
	A time zone is usually denoted geographically e.g. Australian Eastern Daylight Time, with a constant value in a given region. 
The region where it applies and the offset from UTC are specified by a locally recognised governing authority.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:TimeZone skos:note A designated timezone is associated with a geographic region. However, for a particular region the offset from UTC often varies seasonally, and the dates of the changes may vary from year to year. The timezone designation usually changes for the different seasons e.g. Australian Eastern Standard Time vs. Australian Eastern Daylight Time. Furthermore, the offset for a timezone may change over longer timescales, though its designation might not.  

Detailed guidance about working with time zones is given in http://www.w3.org/TR/timezone/ .^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:minutes skos:definition length, or element of, a temporal extent expressed in minutes^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:intervalFinishedBy skos:definition If a proper interval T1 is intervalFinishedBy another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is before the beginning of T2, and the end of T1 is coincident with the end of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:inXSDgYearMonth rdfs:comment Position of an instant, expressed using xsd:gYearMonth^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:inTemporalPosition rdfs:comment Position of a time instant^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:DurationDescription rdfs:comment Description of temporal extent structured with separate values for the various elements of a calendar-clock system. The temporal reference system is fixed to Gregorian Calendar, and the range of each of the numeric properties is restricted to xsd:decimal^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:numericPosition rdfs:comment The numeric value indicating position within a temporal coordinate system ^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:intervalMeets skos:definition If a proper interval T1 is intervalMeets another proper interval T2, then the end of T1 is coincident with the beginning of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:MonthOfYear skos:editorialNote Feature at risk - added in 2017 revision, and not yet widely used. ^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:Instant skos:definition A temporal entity with zero extent or duration^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:generalYear rdfs:comment Year number - formulated as a text string with a pattern constraint to reproduce the same lexical form as gYear, but not restricted to values from the Gregorian calendar. 
Note that the value-space is not defined, so a generic OWL2 processor cannot compute ordering relationships of values of this type.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:weeks rdfs:comment length of, or element of the length of, a temporal extent expressed in weeks^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:dayOfYear skos:definition The number of the day within the year^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:TimeZone skos:scopeNote In this implementation TimeZone has no properties defined. It should be thought of as an abstract superclass of all specific timezone implementations.
time:dayOfWeek skos:definition The day of week, whose value is a member of the class time:DayOfWeek^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:unitMonth rdfs:label Month unit of temporal duration^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:minute skos:definition Minute position in a calendar-clock system.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:MonthOfYear skos:definition The month of the year^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:intervalAfter rdfs:comment If a proper interval T1 is intervalAfter another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is after the end of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:Duration rdfs:comment Duration of a temporal extent expressed as a number scaled by a temporal unit^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:GeneralDurationDescription skos:definition Description of temporal extent structured with separate values for the various elements of a calendar-clock system.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:monthOfYear skos:editorialNote Feature at risk - added in 2017 revision, and not yet widely used. ^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:Duration skos:note Alternative to time:DurationDescription to support description of a temporal duration other than using a calendar/clock system.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:January skos:historyNote This class was present in the 2006 version of OWL-Time. It was presented as an example of how DateTimeDescription could be specialized, but does not belong in the revised ontology.
time:inXSDDateTime skos:definition Position of an instant, expressed using xsd:dateTime^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:TemporalUnit skos:note Membership of the class TemporalUnit is open, to allow for other temporal units used in some technical applications e.g. millions of years, Bahai month.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:hasDuration skos:definition Duration of a temporal entity, event or activity, or thing, expressed as a scaled value^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:hasTime skos:definition Supports the association of a temporal entity instant or interval to any thing^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:inXSDDateTimeStamp rdfs:comment Position of an instant, expressed using xsd:dateTimeStamp^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:DateTimeInterval skos:definition DateTimeInterval is a subclass of ProperInterval, defined using the multi-element DateTimeDescription.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:hasXSDDuration rdfs:comment Extent of a temporal entity, expressed using xsd:duration^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:inside rdfs:comment An instant that falls inside the interval. It is not intended to include beginnings and ends of intervals.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:intervalMetBy rdfs:comment If a proper interval T1 is intervalMetBy another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is coincident with the end of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:intervalBefore rdfs:comment If a proper interval T1 is intervalBefore another proper interval T2, then the end of T1 is before the beginning of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:hasDateTimeDescription rdfs:comment Value of DateTimeInterval expressed as a structured value. The beginning and end of the interval coincide with the limits of the shortest element in the description.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
http://www.w3.org/2006/time skos:changeNote 2016-06-15 - initial update of OWL-Time - modified to support arbitrary temporal reference systems.

time:intervalStarts skos:definition If a proper interval T1 is intervalStarts another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is coincident with the beginning of T2, and the end of T1 is before the end of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:hour rdfs:comment Hour position in a calendar-clock system.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:week rdfs:comment Week number within the year.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:TimePosition rdfs:comment A temporal position described using either a nominal value from an ordinal reference system, or a numeric value in a temporal coordinate system. ^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:generalDay skos:definition Day of month - formulated as a text string with a pattern constraint to reproduce the same lexical form as gDay, except that values up to 99 are permitted, in order to support calendars with more than 31 days in a month. 
Note that the value-space is not defined, so a generic OWL2 processor cannot compute ordering relationships of values of this type.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:intervalDuring rdfs:comment If a proper interval T1 is intervalDuring another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is after the beginning of T2, and the end of T1 is before the end of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:TemporalDuration skos:definition Time extent; duration of a time interval separate from its particular start position^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:Interval skos:definition A temporal entity with an extent or duration^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:week skos:note Weeks are numbered differently depending on the calendar in use and the local language or cultural conventions locale. ISO-8601 specifies that the first week of the year includes at least four days, and that Monday is the first day of the week. In that system, week 1 is the week that contains the first Thursday in the year.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:Year skos:historyNote Year was proposed in the 2006 version of OWL-Time as an example of how DurationDescription could be specialized to allow for a duration to be restricted to a number of years. 

It is deprecated in this edition of OWL-Time.

time:intervalDisjoint skos:definition If a proper interval T1 is intervalDisjoint another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is after the end of T2, or the end of T1 is before the beginning of T2, i.e. the intervals do not overlap in any way, but their ordering relationship is not known.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:nominalPosition rdfs:comment The nominal value indicating temporal position in an ordinal reference system ^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:unitMinute rdfs:label Minute unit of temporal duration^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:GeneralDateTimeDescription skos:note Some combinations of properties are redundant - for example, within a specified :year if :dayOfYear is provided then :day and :month can be computed, and vice versa. Individual values should be consistent with each other and the calendar, indicated through the value of the :hasTRS property.

time:intervalFinishes rdfs:comment If a proper interval T1 is intervalFinishes another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is after the beginning of T2, and the end of T1 is coincident with the end of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:inXSDDate skos:definition Position of an instant, expressed using xsd:date^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:after rdfs:comment Gives directionality to time. If a temporal entity T1 is after another temporal entity T2, then the beginning of T1 is after the end of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:inDateTime rdfs:comment Position of an instant, expressed using a structured description^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:days skos:definition length of, or element of the length of, a temporal extent expressed in days^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:monthOfYear skos:definition The month of the year, whose value is a member of the class time:MonthOfYear^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:TimeZone skos:historyNote In the original 2006 version of OWL-Time, the TimeZone class, with several properties corresponding to a specific model of time-zones, was defined in a separate namespace "http://www.w3.org/2006/timezone#". 

In the current version a class with same local name is put into the main OWL-Time namespace, removing the dependency on the external namespace. 

An alignment axiom 
	tzont:TimeZone rdfs:subClassOf time:TimeZone . 
allows data encoded according to the previous version to be consistent with the updated ontology.

time:ProperInterval skos:definition A temporal entity with non-zero extent or duration, i.e. for which the value of the beginning and end are different^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:numericPosition rdfs:label Numeric value of temporal position^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:intervalContains skos:definition If a proper interval T1 is intervalContains another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is before the beginning of T2, and the end of T1 is after the end of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:unitYear rdfs:label Year unit of temporal duration^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:inTimePosition rdfs:comment Position of an instant, expressed as a temporal coordinate or nominal value^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:DateTimeDescription skos:definition Description of date and time structured with separate values for the various elements of a calendar-clock system. The temporal reference system is fixed to Gregorian Calendar, and the range of year, month, day properties restricted to corresponding XML Schema types xsd:gYear, xsd:gMonth and xsd:gDay, respectively.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:hours skos:definition length of, or element of the length of, a temporal extent expressed in hours^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:GeneralDateTimeDescription rdfs:comment Description of date and time structured with separate values for the various elements of a calendar-clock system^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:intervalOverlappedBy skos:definition If a proper interval T1 is intervalOverlappedBy another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is after the beginning of T2, the beginning of T1 is before the end of T2, and the end of T1 is after the end of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:hasTemporalDuration skos:definition Duration of a temporal entity.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:TemporalPosition rdfs:comment A position on a time-line^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:TemporalUnit rdfs:comment A standard duration, which provides a scale factor for a time extent, or the granularity or precision for a time position.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:inTimePosition skos:definition Position of a time instant expressed as a TimePosition^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:hasTRS rdfs:comment The temporal reference system used by a temporal position or extent description. ^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:intervalEquals skos:definition If a proper interval T1 is intervalEquals another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is coincident with the beginning of T2, and the end of T1 is coincident with the end of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:intervalOverlaps rdfs:comment If a proper interval T1 is intervalOverlaps another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is before the beginning of T2, the end of T1 is after the beginning of T2, and the end of T1 is before the end of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:numericDuration rdfs:label Numeric value of temporal duration^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:intervalStartedBy skos:definition If a proper interval T1 is intervalStarted another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is coincident with the beginning of T2, and the end of T1 is after the end of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:inXSDgYear rdfs:comment Position of an instant, expressed using xsd:gYear^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:intervalIn rdfs:comment If a proper interval T1 is intervalIn another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is after the beginning of T2 or is coincident with the beginning of T2, and the end of T1 is before the end of T2, or is coincident with the end of T2, except that end of T1 may not be coincident with the end of T2 if the beginning of T1 is coincident with the beginning of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:day skos:definition Day position in a calendar-clock system.

The range of this property is not specified, so can be replaced by any specific representation of a calendar day from any calendar. ^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:hasDurationDescription rdfs:comment Duration of a temporal entity, expressed using a structured description^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
InvalidAxioms: time:hours rdfs:subClassOf The nominal value indicating temporal position in an ordinal reference system ^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
bbf07fd5-28fe-4bbb-8c1a-96a0f6ab6dd9 rdfs:subClassOf 2017-02 - intervalIn, intervalDisjoint, monthOfYear added; TemporalUnit subclass of TemporalDuration

time:Monday rdfs:subClassOf A Time Zone specifies the amount by which the local time is offset from UTC. 
	A time zone is usually denoted geographically e.g. Australian Eastern Daylight Time, with a constant value in a given region. 
The region where it applies and the offset from UTC are specified by a locally recognised governing authority.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:DateTimeDescription rdf:type A position on a time-line^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
owl:DeprecatedClass owl:allValuesFrom Copyright © 2006-2017 W3C, OGC. W3C and OGC liability, trademark and document use rules apply.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:TimePosition rdf:type A position on a time-line^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

0a028d39-a386-45cd-bdc1-0b92b0b66ead rdfs:subClassOf Month position in a calendar-clock system.

The range of this property is not specified, so can be replaced by any specific representation of a calendar month from any calendar. ^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
7829c96e-a2b0-4a7e-96ca-72af73cf3221 rdf:type 2016-06-15 - initial update of OWL-Time - modified to support arbitrary temporal reference systems.

830649cb-a285-43a9-98bb-bb3df38b44ff rdfs:label DateTimeInterval is a subclass of ProperInterval, defined using the multi-element DateTimeDescription.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
43db04d9dab48011cde1c69ecbbc5b96 rdf:type Minute position in a calendar-clock system.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:Interval rdfs:comment Gives directionality to time. If a temporal entity T1 is after another temporal entity T2, then the beginning of T1 is after the end of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
owl:TransitiveProperty rdfs:range Position of an instant, expressed using xsd:gYearMonth^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
5aecc85b-be56-409c-b8c7-b2c77175388b rdf:type The numeric value indicating position within a temporal coordinate system ^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:intervalAfter rdfs:subClassOf Position of an instant, expressed using xsd:dateTime^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:DateTimeDescription rdfs:label The numeric value indicating position within a temporal coordinate system ^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:unitYear owl:maxCardinality Month of year - formulated as a text string with a pattern constraint to reproduce the same lexical form as gMonth, except that values up to 20 are permitted, in order to support calendars with more than 12 months in the year. 
Note that the value-space is not defined, so a generic OWL2 processor cannot compute ordering relationships of values of this type.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

abd8e501-cf0a-49e6-b75c-f37610bbc8ae rdfs:subClassOf In the Gregorian calendar the length of the month is not fixed. Therefore, a value like "2.5 months" cannot be exactly compared with a similar duration expressed in terms of weeks or days.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:Wednesday skos:prefLabel is controlled by device

:Network owl:allValuesFrom Year was proposed in the 2006 version of OWL-Time as an example of how DurationDescription could be specialized to allow for a duration to be restricted to a number of years. 

It is deprecated in this edition of OWL-Time.

:Stop owl:maxCardinality Year position in a calendar-clock system.

The range of this property is not specified, so can be replaced by any specific representation of a calendar year from any calendar. ^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

:Currency rdfs:label A Time Zone specifies the amount by which the local time is offset from UTC. 
	A time zone is usually denoted geographically e.g. Australian Eastern Daylight Time, with a constant value in a given region. 
The region where it applies and the offset from UTC are specified by a locally recognised governing authority.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
rdfs:Literal rdfs:subClassOf Position of an instant, expressed using xsd:gYearMonth^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

:hasMeterReading skos:prefLabel In the original 2006 version of OWL-Time, the range of time:timeZone was a TimeZone class in a separate namespace "http://www.w3.org/2006/timezone#". 
An alignment axiom 
	tzont:TimeZone rdfs:subClassOf time:TimeZone . 
allows data encoded according to the previous version to be consistent with the updated ontology.
:Generator rdfs:subClassOf The numeric value indicating position within a temporal coordinate system ^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

:DoorSwitch rdfs:label A temporal reference system, such as a temporal coordinate system with an origin, direction, and scale, a calendar-clock combination, or a possibly hierarchical ordinal system. 

This is a stub class, representing the set of all temporal reference systems.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

om:kelvin rdfs:subClassOf Month position in a calendar-clock system.

The range of this property is not specified, so can be replaced by any specific representation of a calendar month from any calendar. ^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
:State rdfs:subClassOf Duration of a temporal entity, expressed using a structured description^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

3f94546f-888a-4602-bf53-a1b3ef49e576 rdfs:label Month of year - formulated as a text string with a pattern constraint to reproduce the same lexical form as gMonth, except that values up to 20 are permitted, in order to support calendars with more than 12 months in the year. 
Note that the value-space is not defined, so a generic OWL2 processor cannot compute ordering relationships of values of this type.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:DateTimeDescription rdf:type Description of date and time structured with separate values for the various elements of a calendar-clock system. The temporal reference system is fixed to Gregorian Calendar, and the range of year, month, day properties restricted to corresponding XML Schema types xsd:gYear, xsd:gMonth and xsd:gDay, respectively.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
f9cd470c307ceecd479b9a4789169c74 rdf:type Position of a time instant expressed as a TimePosition^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

:Switch rdf:type If a proper interval T1 is intervalContains another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is before the beginning of T2, and the end of T1 is after the end of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:hasDurationDescription rdfs:domain Year number - formulated as a text string with a pattern constraint to reproduce the same lexical form as gYear, but not restricted to values from the Gregorian calendar. 
Note that the value-space is not defined, so a generic OWL2 processor cannot compute ordering relationships of values of this type.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
8e3bff09-ffd9-4871-b760-b14d45fd7e1c rdf:type Position of an instant, expressed as a temporal coordinate or nominal value^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:hour owl:deprecated Description of temporal extent structured with separate values for the various elements of a calendar-clock system. The temporal reference system is fixed to Gregorian Calendar, and the range of each of the numeric properties is restricted to xsd:decimal^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
time:Year rdfs:domain 2017-04-06 - hasTime, hasXSDDuration added; Number removed; all duration elements changed to xsd:decimal

:StepUpCommand rdfs:domain An ontology for time zone descriptions was described in [owl-time-20060927] and provided as RDF in a separate namespace tzont:. However, that ontology was incomplete in scope, and the example datasets were selective. Furthermore, since the use of a class from an external ontology as the range of an ObjectProperty in OWL-Time creates a dependency, reference to the time zone class has been replaced with the stub class in the normative part of this version of OWL-Time.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
:StartCommand skos:definition The nominal value indicating temporal position in an ordinal reference system ^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

:Appliance rdfs:subClassOf If a proper interval T1 is intervalFinishedBy another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is before the beginning of T2, and the end of T1 is coincident with the end of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString

time:months rdfs:subClassOf If a proper interval T1 is intervalFinishes another proper interval T2, then the beginning of T1 is after the beginning of T2, and the end of T1 is coincident with the end of T2.^^http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#langString
